body: Sunderland really need to win this to keep their survival hopes intact but considering they have not scored in their last three home games and how they have historically struggled against last season’s champions – winning only two of the past 24 meetings – it will not be easy. Sam Allardyce’s team will also know Norwich’s result by the time they get under way potentially adding more pressure. Alan Smith Kick-off Saturday 3pm  Venue Stadium of Light Last season Sunderland 0 Chelsea 0 Referee Mike Jones This season G26, Y75, R2, 3.04 cards per game Odds H 9-5 A 7-5 D 5-2 Sunderland Subs from Pickford, O’Shea, Brown, Jones, Rodwell, Larsson, Toivonen, Watmore, Lens, N’Doye, Watmore Doubtful Jones (hip) Injured None Suspended None Form DDLWDD Discipline Y61 R2 Leading scorer Defoe 14 Chelsea Subs from Amelia, Begovic, Rahman, Clarke-Salter, Mizaga, Kenedy, Oscar, Pedro, Falcao, Palmer, Loftus-Cheek, Traoré, Pato Doubtful None Injured Rémy (groin, Aug), Zouma (knee, Oct) Suspended None Form DWLLWD Discipline Y57 R4 Leading scorer Costa 11
